sentences.en: A regular rhythm pulsated in our ears.
sentences.cn: 一种平均的节奏在我们耳边颤动着.

sentences.en: Begin to listen to your own body rhythms.
sentences.cn: 开始聆听你自己身体的规律性变化。

sentences.en: Drums and cymbals beat out a solemn rhythm.
sentences.cn: 鼓和铙钹奏出了庄严的节奏。

sentences.en: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.cn: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.en: He has an ear for the rhythm of Irish speech.
sentences.cn: 他对爱尔兰语的节奏很敏感.

sentences.en: He launched into a rhythm vigorously.
sentences.cn: 他开始使劲演奏这首曲子.

sentences.en: Her pencil tapped out a staccato rhythm on the desk top.
sentences.cn: 她用铅笔断断续续地敲击着桌面.

sentences.en: His poem has a pleasing rhythm.
His verse has the sing - song rhythm of a poetaster.
sentences.cn: 他的诗句有着蹩脚诗人的单调的节律.

sentences.en: It's a funky sort of rhythm.
sentences.cn: 这种节奏有些乡土爵士乐风格。

sentences.en: She could hear the constant rhythm of his breathing.
sentences.cn: 她能听见他均匀而有节奏的呼吸。

sentences.en: The immediate ancestor of rock "n" roll is rhythm-and-blues.
sentences.cn: 摇滚乐直接源自节奏布鲁斯。

sentences.en: The ship adjusted herself to the roll and rhythm of the sea.
sentences.cn: 船随着海水的起伏节奏时起时落。

sentences.en: The song have a syncopate rhythm in the jazz version.
sentences.cn: 这首歌曲改编为爵士乐後采用了切分音节奏.

sentences.en: They've revivified rhythm and blues singing by giving it dance beats.
sentences.cn: 他们为节奏布鲁斯的歌曲中加入了舞曲的节奏，使之变得更加活跃。

sentences.en: to dance to the rhythm of the music
You can't appreciate English poetry unless you understand its rhythm.
sentences.cn: 你若不懂英文诗韵律,就无法欣赏英文诗.

words.tran_cn: [生物] 有节奏的（等于rhythmical）；间歇的；合拍的

phrases.tran_cn: 生理节律；[化]近昼夜节律；日周期节律
[音]（交响乐队中用以烘托乐曲节奏的）节奏乐器组

trans.tran_cn: [诗]节奏，韵律，[医]节律，规律，[乐]节拍，[艺]调和
trans.tran_en: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements
